\n <h1>Welcome to the Angular a:
Welcome to the Angular and TypeScript CodeLab!

In this codelab we're going to learn the basics of TypeScript and Angular.

We're using Angular version 2.1.0

The slides for the codelab are available using here.
\n <p>We created a TypeScript f:
We created a TypeScript file for you, now let's add our first TS class called Codelab.

It will take a list of guests, and will have a 'getGuestsComing' method, which will only return people who're coming.

As you can see in the 'Main.ts' file we have 4 people signed up, but Charles Darwin had a last minute change of plans, so only 3 people should be returned.
\n <h1>Let's build our first An:
Let's build our first Angular app!

This is how it will look:

Hello CatTube!

3 simple steps:

  1. Create a Component
  2. Create a NgModule
  3. Bootstrap the NgModule
Now we got the component, we need to pas: Now we got the component, we need to pass it to a NgModule.
\n <p>Now we got both NgModule:
Now we got both NgModule and component ready, let's bootstrap the app!

There's no simple way to test it, make sure your app displays: 'Hello CatTube!'

\n <h1>Let's inject parent comp:
Let's inject parent component!

In this milestone we'll create create a ContextAdComponent.

This component will not use inputs. Instead it will require parent (Video) component and directly look at it's properties.

It will display different text depending of if there's a word 'music' in the description.

Cute kitten dancing

Decription: music
Context ad: Turn up your speakers

Cute kitten sleeping

Decription: sleeping
Context ad: Check out our web site.

Note, we are actually calling it ContextComponent, because when it was called ContextAdComponent, adblock blocked it, and I spent 2 hours debugging.
<p>Create a Context(Ad)Component</p>\n:
Create a Context(Ad)Component

which will inject it's parent component, see what thedescription, and display the value accordingly.

Note: We had to get rid of the 'Ad' part of the component, because AdBlock blocked the template.
Create a fuzzy pipe, which takes a date: Create a fuzzy pipe, which takes a date in YYYY-MM-DD format, and returns how many days ago this was.

Modify getGuestsComing to filter the gue:
Modify getGuestsComing to filter the guests array and only return guests with the 'coming' property set to true.
